definitions.text: the number of openings per linear inch of a screen; measures size of particles
the topology of a network whose components are all connected directly to every other component
an open fabric of string or rope or wire woven together at regular intervals
the act of interlocking or meshing
examples: an interlocking of arms by the police held the crowd in check

definitions.text: coordinate in such a way that all parts work together effectively
entangle or catch in (or as if in) a mesh
